column5: My guess for Cedar Lake was May 9, I have been eliminated. Al the camp owner on Cedar Lake posted pictures on his website yesterday. The only open water is the channel under the bridge from Richmond to Nelson Lake. The ice on the lake is not very dark yet. Glad I'm not booked for opening wk.

Well it looks like Perrault will be open before June & my guess was a big long shot. Think it should clear quick it's 37f this morning winter is ending. A few times I have been fishing in August when it started snowing in that area but think this fall will be nice.
I went down to the lake today to check it out.I'm not sure if all of the ice is going to be gone by the weekend .Lots of ice still left out there.Need wind,rain and warmer weather to make it happen.
http://www.hiddenbay.com/photosvideos.htmlMore Pictures posted just today! Lake of the woods, winnipeg and Thunder Bay! Looks like it is melting away, but will it be gone by the weekend?JS
Ice is off Vermilion Bay, Eagle Lake as of May 15th.http://www.electricbeaver.ca/
http://www.fishredpine.com/webcam.htmlThe ice is retreating, more open water each day!!
I guess dreams do come true!! I can't wait to go out Saturday.GOOD LUCK EVERYONE..............
Looks like I hit correctly on the May 20 date for Cordingley.....thank God we can go!!

I heard from Andrea at Goose Bay last night, her sister in I Falls, says Rainy Lake is open now! Too bad no one picked the date and time for Rainy Lake, they could have won the grand prize!Still time to name your lake and date since the prize has not been awarded!

Are you sure? Check out this link for a Rainy Lake webcam. It faces Canada and Sand Bay on Rainy Lake. http://www.rainylakeonestop.com/rainylake_cam.htmlThe ice is looking darker but still has a few days left before it's gone.

I was passing along the info given to me. Perhaps where her sister is is open, but not the whole body of water.http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/ice_out/index.html This site does not have a clear definition for ice out! Thanks for the link, I have several others I like to check to keep the walleye fever under control!
Heard today...coldest April since 1907 in Manitoba. That weather system was shared with NW Ont so, indeed is a very late thaw.....correction.....will be a late thaw, first gotta start.
Eagle Lake, Myers Bay taken 5/1/13
Looks like the palm trees have a way to go till bloom.
Prediction....May 20 for Nakina.
http://www.tomahawkresort.ca/ReginaBayCamera.cfmSome open water close to shore, still need a date for open water for fishing! Any guesses!?

Hey narda hows it going.cant wait for those wings.lol.still pretty frozen.aml side getting a little sun there and is starting to show some water.the docks in the far bay are almost open there.got a long way to go.you guys should be good in aug.lol.catch you later.
Andrea at Goose Bay thinks the NW end of LS will be open, thanks to the flowage, there might still be some ice though! They are getting the minnow traps ready for the season!
http://Picture URLBB CodeHelp trying to post photos what's the secret ?
You sound pretty confident Teddi. I would agree with you except move it all a week later. See ya after ice out.
Warmer weather starting Friday.High +13c,Sat +17c and Sunday +20c.

May 15 for Red Lake, just because I would like it to be so. Could be later. I'm skidooing up the lake by snowmachine getting cabins cleaned and ready to go. Ice is shore to shore with snow still on top. It's warming up here now though and the animals are out and about...tracks everywhere. Eagles nesting. Warm enough for a drink on the deck today. Hmm that sounds good. See ya later. (picture is from 7 am this morning.)
Looks like the temps for Ear Fall and Red Lake will be above freezing even at night for the next couple of days! That will help get things started! Any official predictions!?

Hey all!I was just looking at a website from an outfitter we flew out with a couple of years ago. Going back this summer.They have an Ice Out Watch on their photos page. Latest pictures are from 2 days ago. Pretty cool shots!Looks very frozen up in Ontario still! Where is the global warming we were promised.Here is the link:http://www.hiddenbay.com/photosvideos.htmlI hope they post more to keep us updated!!
http://www.redwinglodge.net/webcam/The snow is gone, still has plenty of ice yet with 17 days to go to for the walleye season opener!
Dave,It looks like the Ice is slowly on its way out...I know one thing if we still have ice up there for my July trip, the last thing I will be concerned with is fishing,,lol

I heard from Andrea, Goose Bay Camp near Ear Falls today. They have some open water near the Wenasaga River, the current on Lac Seul helps with the iceout! She feels pretty sure the ice will not be a factor for May 18th!Maybe my May 8th bid will be the winner! How about yours!?
Ice out in Red Lake week after the 20th....just cant see it before unless a major heat wave and that's not in the forecast.
Predictions for Cordingley Lake in Nakina, Ontario? Getting a little nervous with the forecasts I am seeing for our trip beginning on May 25.

I'd be getting nervous about any trip in May. Here in central MN we just got another foot of snow yesterday(on top of 18"-2' that was already here). Lakes haven't even "thought" about starting to open up. I can about imagine what it looks like in ON right about now.

My Dad just spoke with my uncle yesterday that lives on Lac Vieux Desert just north of Eagle River WI it was snowing & ice is thick. My uncle thinks this will be a late ice out May 15th or so. Kabatogama has many feet of ice & snow with more snow / cold coming rest of next two weeks if it doesn't warm up soon it could be June before lakes in Canada open up. I was heading north in about a week now pushed it back a month it's just getting warm in Florida we had a very cold March. My guess Perrualt lake opens June 1st
My prediction for the ice out on Lac Seul is May 13th.
-15c in Dyden, -18c for Red Lake and Ear Falls over night.Instead of melting,it's making ice.Still a ton of snow on top.No end in sight for the cold.

From ear falls to steamboat bay the ice should be out by may15. Going east from steamboat about a week later. Mckenzie bay,manitoba point area will still be ice until the end of may unless things change fast.
May 2014. Flurries in Chicago today after 7" of rain yesterday.

I'll be in Vermilion Bay, On. May 24th, and if there's ice on Indian Lake, WHO CARES,I'm still in Canada and it beats the **** out of Omaha, Ne.!!!! I'll have a COLD glass of 40 Creek rye in my hand, a cigar in the other and my lovelyfishing wife, and 3 weeks to watch the ice go out. Glorious!! Besides, it'll give me something to ***** about to my Buddy the owner, Derek Becker!! Cold Beer for everybody!!
Picture URL BB Code
[IMG]https://www.walleyecentral.com/forums/picture.php?alb
I'll take May 11 for the SE side of Lac Seul. Don't need a prize. Just knowing I was right and I won't be there in case I'm wrong is enough.

Ill help you out with the prize dave when my check comes in to.iam going with may12 .at 4:00 pm for eagle. and as far as nw lac suel be the same.the ice hasnt even lifted yet on either lake or any other lakes.going fishing tomm on cliff lake i am going to take a measurment of whats there.

Here is the dryden forecast for the next ten days:tonight Low 18fWed. High 39f Low 26f chance of snow Thur. High 38f Low 25f chance of snow Fri. High 36f Low 13fSat. High 38f Low 31fSun. High 40 Low 31f chance of snowMon. High 40f Low 25fTues. High 43f Low 26fWed. High 49f Low 31fThurs. High 48f Low 34fIt will be the 25th of April before we get our first night of the spring that isn't below freezing. Right now we are way behind schedule with the weather. Unless things change for the warmer drastically, we might be looking at a record late ice out.If the weather keeps going with this slow warming pattern, I am guessing (hoping) May 18 for Lower Manitou Lake - and that might be early?
how fitting..a record late ice out after a record early one...fwiw, heres that 25 day for Perrault Falls..http://www.accuweather.com/en/ca/per...forecast/49589

I am predicting record late ice out in NE MN & Ontario too. Lakes around Virginia, MN (Lake Vermilion) still are covered with an insulation layer of white snow with 3-9" of snow predicted for next 3 days. Guys I know are still ice fishing for crappies & sunnies & say they have to put the ice auger all the way down to the head meaning there us still 2 1/2 - 3 ft of ice here on area lakes! It looks & feels like December around here NOT April!

Talked to Don Elliot at Mattice Lake Outfitters on Tuesday, he said he was ice fishing the previous day and the ice was four feet deep with a foot and a half of snow on top of it . Their long term forecast was not looking very promising either . We don't fly in until about June 7 , so we should be ok by then ,I hope. LOL. I don't have any guesss when ice will be out there. But I do remember my best fishing the second week of June has been great, with a late ice out.
Umferville lake (Caribou Falls) Ice Out 8 May..What a coincidence we are both waiting on that Nigerian Bank to cut our checks for the oil holdings...Joe,

Hey Wallydave, those Nigerian buckaroos don't spend too well in the Northland!! Hey V-Bay Gord, talked to the Timmy Lindholm meister sunday, he said a foot of snow on the ground,and 28ins. of ice is what he's heard down on at the Corner, if you see him, tell him his Nebraska bud says Hi, stay safe you All !!
Im saying may 19th on wabaskang.
Depends on the exchange rate eh!

Last year was a record early ice out, this year looks to be at least average ice out.For this years contest, enter the body of water, date and time your lake will be clear of ice.For my guess for the NW section of Lac Seul will be ice free May 8th by 3:30 PM.Any body else!?
Here is my guess.Lake Minnitaki - May 15 at 8:00 AM

Hey WalleyeDave, I'm on the Indian Lake chain(Vermilion Bay) and my guess is May 5th, I think Derek Becker( the owner of our camp) HOPES SO TOO! I think he might be sweating his canadian balls off if it isn't!!!
Hawk Lake, Kushog and Dogtooth - May 18th.
Eagle Lake, Vermillion Bay area. May 20th 4pm.
What's the prize........and who's the judge?
Sounds like you guys are all dreamers.
Cedar lake May 9th 2:30 pm. Hopefully a repeat of 1997.
Northern section on Lake of the Woods. May 10 11:15

Well Gord, we have to go to the honor system for the judging. We all know fishermen, especially walleye fishermen Never lie, stretch the truth, in any way shape or form! The prize will be determined when my check from Nigeria comes in the mail!
